title: How to Make a Cardboard Keytar Prop

steps.headline: Find a picture of a keytar that you like online then print it out as it will be your reference.
Cut your first cardboard box in half down the seam.
steps.description: You will end up with two halves. Turn one half so it's facing long ways. Using a pencil draw the keytar outline of you choice onto the Cardboard.

steps.headline: Using sharp scissors or a knife cut out the body shape.
steps.description: Now trace the keytar shape onto the remaining half of the cardboard and cut that out too.

steps.headline: Take the second box and cut it in half then trace the keytar shape out again on each half and cut.
steps.description: At this point you should have four shapes.

steps.headline: Using the hot glue gun.
steps.description: Glue the shapes on top of each other in a stacked order. Now you have a solid keytar body.

steps.headline: Squeeze some acrylic paint out onto a plastic plate get a clean dry sponge and lightly dip it into the paint with even strokes paint the front side of the keytar.
Grab your craft foam boards and cut the white one into thick strips.
steps.description: Then cut the black one. Make the black strips a little shorter and thinner.

steps.headline: Look at your picture and using the glue gun stick down the white strips first on the body and overlap them with the black.
Time to decorate.
steps.description: Grab some buttons and rhinestones and stick them in place with a glue gun.

steps.headline: The strap can be made if you want one.
steps.description: Just cut a long piece of ribbon or fabric and glue it to both ends of the keytar.

text: Find a picture of a keytar that you like online then print it out as it will be your reference.  Cut your first cardboard box in half down the seam. You will end up with two halves. Turn one half so it's facing long ways. Using a pencil draw the keytar outline of you choice onto the Cardboard. Using sharp scissors or a knife cut out the body shape. Now trace the keytar shape onto the remaining half of the cardboard and cut that out too. Take the second box and cut it in half then trace the keytar shape out again on each half and cut. At this point you should have four shapes. Using the hot glue gun. Glue the shapes on top of each other in a stacked order. Now you have a solid keytar body. Squeeze some acrylic paint out onto a plastic plate get a clean dry sponge and lightly dip it into the paint with even strokes paint the front side of the keytar. Let it dry. Grab your craft foam boards and cut the white one into thick strips. Then cut the black one. Make the black strips a little shorter and thinner. Look at your picture and using the glue gun stick down the white strips first on the body and overlap them with the black. These are the piano keys. Time to decorate. Grab some buttons and rhinestones and stick them in place with a glue gun. The strap can be made if you want one. Just cut a long piece of ribbon or fabric and glue it to both ends of the keytar.
